meanings.definition: To fail to field or catch a ball properly in sports.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the player misfielded the ball and cost his team a point.
meanings.sent2: The outfielder misfielded the fly ball, allowing the opposing team to score a run.
meanings.sent3: The soccer player misfielded the ball and accidentally kicked it into his own goal!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a jumble of thoughts, causing her to misfield the tennis ball repeatedly.
meanings.sent5: The young baseball player practiced tirelessly to ensure he would never misfield a ball again.

meanings.definition: To make an error in judgment or execution.
meanings.sent1: He misfielded the situation by assuming the wrong person was responsible.
meanings.sent2: The chef misfielded the recipe and ended up with a disastrous dish.
meanings.sent3: She misfielded the directions and got lost in the middle of nowhere.
meanings.sent4: The detective misfielded the suspect's alibi and arrested the wrong person.
meanings.sent5: The student misfielded the exam question and answered completely off-topic.
